thread.title: The flood warning and alerts in place in the wake of Storm Gerrit
thread.title_full: The flood warning and alerts in place in the wake of Storm Gerrit

author: welshnews@dailypost.co.uk (Steve Bagnall)
title: The flood warning and alerts in place in the wake of Storm Gerrit
text: Flood alerts and a flood warning are in place for parts of North and Mid Wales, following heavy downpours and gale force winds, [when Storm Gerrit Struck.](https://www.dailypost.co.uk/news/north-wales-news/storm-gerrit-live-hundreds-without-28356942) Although the worst of the [weather](https://www.dailypost.co.uk/all-about/north-wales-weather) is over, the impact of the storm is still being felt across the UK. At its height wind gusts of 88mph were recorded at Mona on [Anglesey](https://www.dailypost.co.uk/all-about/anglesey), amid [weather alerts. ](https://www.dailypost.co.uk/news/north-wales-news/met-office-extends-north-wales-28352827) Hundreds were also left without power in North Wales yesterday as engineers worked to get supplies restored, following multiple outages. READ MORE: [‘Insane’ Storm Gerrit lightning filmed over North Wales as 90mph gales leave people 'terrified'](https://www.dailypost.co.uk/news/north-wales-news/insane-storm-gerrit-lightning-filmed-28358157) READ MORE: [Wales in path of 'cyclone bomb' this weekend with snow possible next week](https://www.dailypost.co.uk/news/north-wales-news/wales-path-cyclone-bomb-weekend-28355079) Here is the flood warning and flood alerts in place, issued by Natural Resources Wales, as of 8.30am today: Flood warning: - River Severn in the Pool Quay area - The River Severn from Pool Quay to Rhyd-esgyn, including Tirymynach, Rhyd-esgyn Lane and Trederwen Lane Flood alerts: - River Dee communities from Llangollen to Trevalyn Meadows - Communities, businesses and isolated properties along the River Dee including Erbistock, Plas Devon, Almere and Trevalyn Meadows - Lower Dee catchment - Areas around the River Dee from Llangollen to Trevalyn Meadows - River Dee at Bangor on Dee - The community of Bangor on Dee - Upper Dee catchment - Areas around the River Dee from Llanuwchllyn to Llangollen - Vrynwy catchment - River Vyrnwy, River Tanat and River Cain & their tributaries [Sign up now for the latest news on the North Wales Live Whatsapp community](https://www.dailypost.co.uk/news/north-wales-news/join-north-wales-live-whatsapp-27935216) Find out what the weather is up to near you
